{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:03.920
    | text      = Interestingly, a 2016 study in the journal Social Policy lays out some interesting information
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = found by digging into data gathered from school districts that allow corporal punishment.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:13.679
    | text      = Imagine my surprise to read that black students are way more likely to receive corporal punishment,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:18.639
    | text      = in some states, as much as five times more likely than white students.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:22.480
    | text      = Equally troubling, their research revealed that students with protected disability statuses
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:26.519
    | text      = were similarly more likely to be recipients of corporal punishment in schools.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:30.719
    | text      = All of their data was examined for possible explanations that didn't involve bias and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:34.880
    | text      = punishment, but they were all excluded by further examination of the data.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:38.440
    | text      = Pure and simple, black students, male students, and students with disabilities were consistently
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:43.400
    | text      = the target of disproportionate punishment in terms of corporal punishment.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:48.639
    | text      = Their summary is crystal clear.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:50.360
    | text      = Quote, the data make clear that where school corporal punishment continues to be used,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:54.880
    | text      = it is typically used disproportionately with some subgroups of children more likely to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:59.119
    | text      = be corporally punished than others.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:01.199
    | text      = They went in and found that, like, obviously, there's a bias in terms of, like, suspensions
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
